item.title: Autumn Dolomites: Chasing Larches Around Lago Federa
item.description: This post will showÂ a lotÂ of photos of trees,Â sorry about that in advance ðŸ˜… But yes, IÂ actually travelled to Italy to see trees. Specifically, golden larches. We chose Lago Federa because itâ€™s one of the best places to see them in autumn.Â The plan wasÂ a 15-km circular trail with about 900 metres of elevation gain, supposedly doable in 5.5 hours. (Spoiler: it took us seven.)
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Gran Canaria: Where Mountains Meet Coast and Dunes
item.description: Gran Canaria surprised me with its variety.Â Steep mountains, quiet pine forests, and golden dunes by the sea. After Tenerife, which had set the bar pretty high (see post), we werenâ€™t sure if this trip could match it. But over a week on the island, moving between viewpoints, coastal towns, and hiking trails that felt completely different every day, Gran Canaria easily held its own.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: 1-Day Trip to Bohemian-Saxon Switzerland in Autumn
item.description: Autumn is my favourite season to visit Bohemian-Saxon Switzerland. The national park glows with golden colours and, with a bit of luck, the weather makes it magical. This was already our second visit,Â at the exact same late-October weekend as last year, and the once again, the weather did not disappoint. You can see photos from our first tripÂ here. This time, we repeated our favourite full-day hike in Saxon Switzerland and added a few new, shorter stops on the Czech side of the park, which fit nicely into the itinerary.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Day Trips from Pilsen: Autumn Edition Part 2
item.description: I love autumn photography. This time of year, I search for places with the most spectacular colors.Â Last year, I visited some well-known locations - check out this postÂ to read more about them. This year, I set out to findÂ hidden gems and less touristy spots.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Brno: Many Years, Many Favourite Places
item.description: I've been living in Brno for the past 10 years. Sounds like a lot, and it is!Â I've experienced so much here:Â my university studies,Â my first jobs, and buildingÂ true friendships â™¡Â I must have hiked every trail around Brno, especially during the COVID lockdowns.Â Since my time here marks a goodÂ anniversary, I decided to share my favourite spots in Brno for hiking, walking, good coffee or simply wandering around the city â˜ºï¸ŽP. S. I've included some older photos -Â some are a few years old and may not be the best quality, but bear with me!
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Day Trip from Pilsen: Top Places to Visit in Autumn
item.description: October in Czech republic is definitely my favourite. As the autumn reaches itsÂ peak, the landscape is transformed into a palette of warm orange and red colours. Here are some spotsÂ that are worth a visit, especially in autumn!
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Happy Island: Active Holidays on the Island of Rab
item.description: Every year, weÂ lookÂ forward to spendingÂ our holidays in Croatia, exploring different islands. Last year, we visited Ugljan;Â this year weÂ randomly picked Rab. We like the slow island life, so we chose a location in northernÂ CroatiaÂ to shorten our travel time.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Austrian Alps: Trail to Schafberg
item.description: Me and my friend travelled to Austria this spring.Â With the weather being unpredictable atÂ this time of the year, we were looking for a hiking trail that would beÂ safe but challenging at the same time.Â Schafberg seemed to fit the bill perfectly.Â The altitude is not too high (1,783 m), but you essentiallyÂ have to hike all the way up from Wolfgangsee. SchafbergÂ is a mountain peak surrounded by three Austrian lakes -Â Mondsee, Attersee, and Wolfgangsee.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Easter Holidays in Switzerland: Walensee and ZÃ¼rich
item.description: Only five-hour ride, that didn't take long to decide for a roadtrip to Switzerland during Easter.Â We picked the nearest place with a lake in the Alps which happens to be Walensee. Although random, it turned out to be an amazing choice! The lake is amazing and there are many hiking routes and destinations around the lake.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Saxon Switzerland: Autumn Hiking Trails
item.description: Two years ago, we hiked through Saxon Switzerland with my best friend during autumn while sleeping in the car. We were lucky that we had sunny weather throughout the whole trip, so the sceneries were truly beautiful in this part of the year.Â We arrivedÂ late afternoon to Pfaffendorf to do a quick hike to catch a sunset from Pfaffenstein (trail here).
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Roadtrip to Poland: What to see around Krakow
item.description: This trip to Poland was one of those random roadtrips we made because it was the only place nearby whereÂ it did not rain. And since we didn't want to waste our holidays, we headed east with no plan in mind. Recently, I bought a new ND filter which is the reason this post will contain mostly portraits and weird experiments. I mostly shoot landscapes but change is always a good practiceÂ â˜ºï¸ŽAlso the photos were taken a year ago. It is crazy to see how much I progressed or changed my color grading and taste in general.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: High Tatras: Koprovsky Stit Hiking Trail
item.description: July was the perfect month to go hiking in Slovak High Tatras. Our aim was to hike up the Koprovsky Stit (2,363Â m). The hike starts at a large parking lot at Strbske pleso and takes you around several other lakes. It has a total elevation of approximatelyÂ 1,100 m. The hike takes around 9-10 hours depending on your fitness level.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Exploring Ugljan: Holidays on the Dalmatian Islands
item.description: Ugljan is a Dalmatian Island connected by a ferry toÂ Zadar. We stayed inÂ LukoranÂ which is a 1-hour walk from Preko (or 5 minutes by carÂ â˜ºï¸Ž ). All the places mentioned in this article are also available in the followingÂ google map.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Tenerife Nomad Part II: East Coast and Anaga Park
item.description: After two weeks exploring northern part of Tenerife (which you can read more about here), we moved to another location in Anaga Park. We wanted to do some more hiking and enjoy calm holidays in San Andres.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Tenerife Nomad Part I: North Coast and Teide Park
item.description: February tends to be very cold in Czech republic so we decided to head to tropical Canary islands - Tenerife. We will be spending the first two weeks exploring the northern part with our base in Los Realejos. It is close to Puerto de Cruz with good bus connections, it is surrounded by huge mountains and green landscape.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Two-Week Roadtrip in Greece: Top 3 Places to Visit
item.description: Last year in September, we spent two weeks roadtripping around Greece, sleeping in campsitesÂ in a tiny Kia Ceed. I put up together a map with the route and all the places we visited. I must say two weeks are definitely not enough to visit all the beautiful places in Greece, but anyways was very well worth it. In this article, I choose my top three places from the whole trip that I recommend everyone to visit.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Roadtrip to North Tyrol: Stunning Lake Hiking Trails
item.description: In May 2023, me and my best friend went to see Tyrol for the first time. And it was definitely not the last. The landscapes were just stunning. Hey, you'll see.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: One-Week Itinerary for Dublin in Autumn
item.description: October 2022, I visited a friend in Dublin. I spent most of the days hiking and drinking coffee, and I am glad thatÂ I managed to squeezeÂ most of the natural wonders in one single week. I did not have a car, so I travelled mostly using public transport, though me and my friend also did one tour to the west coast.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Winter Hiking in Jizera Mountains and Jested
item.description: Last winter, me and my friend stayed in Liberec to explore the Jizera mountains along with Jested. Jizera mountains are located on the border between Czechia and Poland.
item.author: Rene Hlavova

item.title: Digital Nomading in Madeira
item.description: One year ago, I spent a month working remotely from Madeira. As much as I love autumn, November is a dark, grey, and cold month in Czechia so I decided to leave. â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹
